Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in dismissing the appeal for lack of jurisdiction when a family class member was involved
Evidence_Assessment: Doubts about the legality of adoption in Cambodia
Decision_Outcome: Board dismissed appeal for lack of jurisdiction
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove legal adoption and eligibility
Credibility_Factor: Authenticity and legality of Cambodian adoption documentation
Legal_Rule: An appeal lies if a member of the family class is refused; orphans under 19 qualify
Procedural_Issue: Board's refusal to recognize nephew as co-applicant and family class member
Grounds_for_Claim: Improper exclusion of nephew from application due to unproven inadmissibility
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; case remitted for reconsideration
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board failed to properly assess jurisdiction, raising fairness concerns
Key_Evidence_Considered: Proof of legal adoption in Cambodia
Legal_Framework: Family class membership, orphan definition, appeal rights under Immigration Act
Applicant_Challenge: Board lacked jurisdiction after excluding nephew
Defendant_Response: Visa officer removed nephew due to insufficient proof of adoption
Outcome: Appeal dismissed initially; judicial review allowed; case remitted
Decision_Authority: Immigration Appeal Division, Federal Court on review
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review, remittal for new hearing
Claimant_Status: Nephew as potential family class member (orphan under 19)
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Reassessment of nephew's eligibility and appeal jurisdiction
